body_html:
You shouldn't need to install pybind11, since (as you guessed) we'll use pybind11 under third_party. I've put up a pull request to improve that messaging and I'd recommend removing it.

After that can you try running the command below and see if you get the same errors?

NO_CUDA=1 python3 setup.py install

or, to build a develop version

NO_CUDA=1 python3 setup.py build_deps develop

It's possible passing the CMake args directly rather than through environment variables is affecting the way our tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh is managing things.

It's possible passing the CMake args directly rather than through environment variables is affecting the way our tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh is managing things.
body:
You shouldn't need to install pybind11, since (as you guessed) we'll use pybind11 under third_party. I've  put up a pull request to improve that messaging and I'd recommend removing it.

After that can you try running the command below and see if you get the same errors?

```
NO_CUDA=1 python3 setup.py install
```

or, to build a develop version

```
NO_CUDA=1 python3 setup.py build_deps develop
```

It's possible passing the CMake args directly rather than through environment variables is affecting the way our tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh is managing things.
